intro: [WRONG START] Astellia subrigida, commonly known as the silver fern, is a striking plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, feathery foliage that resembles a fern. The plant features long, narrow leaves with a silvery-blue hue due to a dense covering of fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Astelia subrigida is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is well-suited for shady garden environments.
